Broken link that previous post: micro.blog

You can see this post has a canonical URL at a domain I control: danj.ca. So I can make quick, Twitter/Instagram-like posts from my own, and they can be syndicated here, but the content is mine.

So among the reasons I‚Äôm no Facebook fan is my desire to control and own the words I publish and share on the internet. I‚Äôm a supporter of the IndieWeb, but, then again, I can build and host my own websites, so it‚Äôs easy to be.

Here‚Äôs a tool that makes owning your content a bit more accessible: [micro.blog][]. I backed the Kickstarter and am playing around with the service.

Moving from Winnipeg to Vancouver it was like, wow, there‚Äôs great coffee everywhere!

The corollary to (2) being, since Marley Spoon gives you the spices they think should go in their recipe, you should add your own.

Tried my first Marley Spoon recipe today, discovered,

  1. Should have just cooked rice the way I have for a decade instead of following their directions
  2. Always use more spices than a recipe says.

I am incapable of starting any online-publishing venture with other than the following:

Hello, World
